bug.author: SheharyarTkxel
bug.description:
Kubeflow Dashboard doesn't have any Namespace in the dropdown. I've already gone through this <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/pull/159/commits/273395ad7a45338815827f72dfda7348e32ad0f0>fix</denchmark-link> but it wasn't required since the yaml files in 0.6.1 version already includes those additions which have been suggested in the fix. Environment:
Kubeflow version: v0.6.1-rc.2-1-g3a37cbc6 Kubernetes version: 1.13

comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label kind/bug to this issue, with a confidence of 0.85. Please mark this comment with üëç or üëé to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/kubeflow/kubeflow>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.

I have the same issue here. I found that I'm using the file <denchmark-link:https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/master/bootstrap/config/kfctl_k8s_istio.yaml>https://raw.githubusercontent.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/master/bootstrap/config/kfctl_k8s_istio.yaml</denchmark-link> as the config file for the stage. This file makes Kubeflow always pull the head version from the repository which could be broken by frequent commits. ... spec: repos: - name: manifests root: manifests-master uri: https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/archive/master.tar.gz - name: kubeflow root: kubeflow-master uri: https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/archive/master.tar.gz ... I changed the URLs to point at a defined release version from the repository, then continue with the kfctl generate and kfctl apply stages and it worked for me: ... spec: repos: - name: manifests root: manifests-master uri: https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/archive/v0.6.1.tar.gz - name: kubeflow root: kubeflow-master uri: https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/archive/v0.6.1.tar.gz ... Hope it helps.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/dss77>@dss77</denchmark-link> Thank you very much, it worked! I am following this <denchmark-link:https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/aws/deploy/install-kubeflow/>tutorial</denchmark-link> and I had to change the config file name "kfctl_aws.yaml". Specified the versions like you directed and the namespaces started showing up. Thanks alot!

It doesn't work for me with 0.6.1 releases of manifests and kubeflow: Error: couldn't generate KfApp: (kubeflow.error): Code 500 with message: kfApp Generate failed for kustomize: kustomize generate failed Error: (kubeflow.error): Code 500 with message: couldn't copy application istio-ingress Is seems that is missing in manifests but is referred from <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/blob/v0.6-branch/bootstrap/config/kfctl_aws.yaml>kfctl_aws.yaml</denchmark-link> in 0.6 branch. In fact the whole folder was added later and didn't make it to manifests release. See the 0.6 branch state of <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/tree/v0.6-branch>manifests</denchmark-link>
How come it worked for you?

It doesn't work for me with 0.6.1 releases of manifests and kubeflow: Error: couldn't generate KfApp: (kubeflow.error): Code 500 with message: kfApp Generate failed for kustomize: kustomize generate failed Error: (kubeflow.error): Code 500 with message: couldn't copy application istio-ingress Is seems that aws/istio-ingress is missing in manifests but is referred from kfctl_aws.yaml in 0.6 branch. In fact the whole aws folder was added later and didn't make it to 0.6.1 manifests release. See the 0.6 branch state of manifests How come it worked for you?
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/vcarnogu>@vcarnogu</denchmark-link>
0.6.1 was not working for me either; It didn't even deploy to start with and I couldn't reach the Dashboard. I used <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/releases/tag/v0.6.1-rc.2>v0.6.1-rc.2</denchmark-link> and it worked fine. I am not sure about your issue but what I was facing with v0.6.1-rc.2 was that in the Dashboard there were no Namespaces in the dropdown. What I did was, as directed by <denchmark-link:https://github.com/dss77>@dss77</denchmark-link> , I changed the versions like this "<denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/archive/v0.6.1-rc.2.tar.gz>https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/archive/v0.6.1-rc.2.tar.gz</denchmark-link> " in the suggested lines and it worked for me. Also, while we are on the subject, another issue I faced with v0.6.1-rc.2 was that the jupyter notebook wouldn't launch. I executed this line to make it work: kubectl -n kubeflow create serviceaccount default-editor --dry-run=true -o yaml | kubectl apply -f -

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/SheharyarTkxel>@SheharyarTkxel</denchmark-link> Thanks. It worked with v0.6.1-rc.2. It is a version from master branch while 0.6.1 is from the v0.6-branch. So confusing. Thanks a lot.

when i do this with 0.6.1-rc.2 i get the below error couldn't generate KfApp: (kubeflow.error): Code 500 with message: kfApp Generate failed for kustomize: kustomize generate failed Error: (kubeflow.error): Code 500 with message: couldn't copy application knative-crds i am using the below <denchmark-h:h2>cyril@tensorflowextended:/kfapp$ diff -bitw /home/cyril/kfctl_k8s_istio.yaml /home/cyril/kfctl_k8s_istio.yaml.orig 13c13 < uri: https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/archive/v0.6.1-rc.2.tar.gz</denchmark-h>
uri: https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/archive/master.tar.gz
<denchmark-h:h2>16c16 < uri: https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/archive/v0.6.1-rc.2.tar.gz</denchmark-h>
uri: https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/archive/master.tar.gz
cyril@tensorflowextended:/kfapp$
can one of you please advise since it looks like i may need a new version

when i do this with 0.6.1-rc.2 i get the below error couldn't generate KfApp: (kubeflow.error): Code 500 with message: kfApp Generate failed for kustomize: kustomize generate failed Error: (kubeflow.error): Code 500 with message: couldn't copy application knative-crds i am using the below cyril@tensorflowextended:/kfapp$ diff -bitw /home/cyril/kfctl_k8s_istio.yaml /home/cyril/kfctl_k8s_istio.yaml.orig 13c13 < uri: https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/archive/v0.6.1-rc.2.tar.gz
uri: https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/archive/master.tar.gz
16c16 < uri: https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/archive/v0.6.1-rc.2.tar.gz
uri: https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/archive/master.tar.gz
cyril@tensorflowextended:/kfapp$
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/cyrilthank>@cyrilthank</denchmark-link> : I hope you are using Kubeflow's official installation guide. If yes then please follow <denchmark-link:https://github.com/dss77>@dss77</denchmark-link> 's answer that is at the top of this post. Make sure you have changed the versions from master to 0.6.1-rc.2 in the kfctl_config.yaml file like this:
Give it a fresh try and see if it works.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/SheharyarTkxel>@SheharyarTkxel</denchmark-link>
Thanks for the reply I am following <denchmark-link:https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/started/k8s/overview/>https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/started/k8s/overview/</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/notebooks/setup/>https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/notebooks/setup/</denchmark-link>
and as per the diff above i did try <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/archive/v0.6.1-rc.2.tar.gz>https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/archive/v0.6.1-rc.2.tar.gz</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/archive/v0.6.1-rc.2.tar.gz>https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/archive/v0.6.1-rc.2.tar.gz</denchmark-link>
can you please advise me what i am doing wrong Please let me know if there is another location where i need to look for the official kubeflow documentation

@SheharyarTkxel Thanks for the reply I am following https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/started/k8s/overview/ https://www.kubeflow.org/docs/notebooks/setup/ and as per the diff above i did try https://github.com/kubeflow/manifests/archive/v0.6.1-rc.2.tar.gz https://github.com/kubeflow/kubeflow/archive/v0.6.1-rc.2.tar.gz can you please advise me what i am doing wrong Please let me know if there is another location where i need to look for the official kubeflow documentation
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/cyrilthank>@cyrilthank</denchmark-link> : Your links suggest you are working on your local system? I worked on AWS and its guide worked fine. If you are also on AWS then ping me on Skype (sheharyar_pointman) and I'll share a step-by-by guide I compiled during my journey.
